intro: Angraecum scalariforme, commonly known as the star orchid, is a climbing epiphytic orchid native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its striking white, star-shaped flowers with long, slender petals and a prominent central column. The plant produces a single spike of flowers, which typically blooms at night, attracting specific pollinators like the hawkmoth. Its unique floral structure is adapted for nocturnal pollination, showcasing an evolutionary adaptation to its environment. Angraecum scalariforme is a rare and endangered species, making it a subject of conservation interest.
